title: Agreement Drills
reading_greek:
DRILL 1: Good (Kalos)
- Ο Φίλος (The Friend)
- Επιλογές: Καλός, Καλή, Καλό (Options: Good masc/fem/neut)
- Σωστό: Καλός (Correct: Masc)

DRILL 2: Big (Megalos)
- Η Πόλη (The City)
- Επιλογές: Μεγάλος, Μεγάλη, Μεγάλο (Options: Big masc/fem/neut)
- Σωστό: Μεγάλη (Correct: Fem)

DRILL 3: Small (Mikros)
- Το Παιδί (The Child)
- Επιλογές: Μικρός, Μικρή, Μικρό (Options: Small masc/fem/neut)
- Σωστό: Μικρό (Correct: Neut)

PLURAL CHALLENGE:
- Οι καλοί φίλοι. (Masc Plural - oi) (The good friends)
- Οι καλές φίλες. (Fem Plural - es) (The good girlfriends)
- Τα καλά παιδιά. (Neut Plural - a) (The good children)
reading_english:
GRAMMAR: PLURAL ADJECTIVES [(See Page 82)](/assets/grammar.pdf#page=82)

1. MASCULINE PLURAL (-oi)
   - O kalos -> Oi kaloi.

2. FEMININE PLURAL (-es)
   - H kali -> Oi kales.

3. NEUTER PLURAL (-a)
   - To kalo -> Ta kala.

Note: These endings (-oi, -es, -a) match the Noun endings exactly for the standard noun groups!
audio_script:
Now we check if you were listening. Agreement!

If the noun is Plural, the Adjective MUST be Plural.

'Oi kaloi filoi' (The good friends).
'Oi kales gynaikes' (The good women).
'Ta kala vivlia' (The good books).

Notice the rhyme?
- Kaloi ... Filoi (-oi)
- Kales ... Gynaikes (-es)
- Kala ... Vivlia (-a)

Greek loves rhyme. If it rhymes, it's usually grammatically correct (for standard nouns)!
